hints.content: Let's look at each name to see which ones can classify our shape.

###Quadrilateral

A quadrilateral is a polygon with $4$ sides.

The shape is a polygon with $4$ sides, so it is a quadrilateral.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
These are quadrilaterals.

![Six different quadrilaterals. Some of the quadrilaterals have sides that are equal in length and some of the quadrilaterals have sides that are not equal in length. Two of the quadrilaterals are rectangles and one is a rhombus.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d82c8ab098090a7311bca960776e59398fc5a4fb)

These are *not* quadrilaterals.

![Three different figures. One is shaped like a crescent, one is a triangle, and one is made up of four lines where the end points of two lines are not connected.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1c7750dd8e5931a47334a4a72af780fba6eb2d34)

hints.content:
###Rectangle

Rectangles are quadrilaterals with $4$ right angles and opposite sides are equal.

The shape is a quadrilateral, but it does **not** have $4$ right angles, so it is **not** a rectangle.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
![Three different rectangles. The first rectangle has equal sides and tick marks in the center of each side. The second and third rectangles have opposite sides that are equal in length and four right angles each.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0424c680a8e306e44bd4e789a57d8f8f8f6cd325)

Yes, a square is also a rectangle, because all $4$ angles are right angles and the opposite sides are equal.

hints.content:
###Rhombus

Rhombuses are quadrilaterals with $4$ sides of equal length. 

The shape is a quadrilateral with $4$ sides of equal length, so it is a rhombus.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
![Three different rhombuses. Each rhombus has four sides equal in length. The second rhombus has right angles that are marked as small squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/499428455220bcad0543bbc547eee14652837b42)

Yes, a square is also a rhombus, because all $4$ sides of a square have the same length.

hints.content:
###Square

Squares are quadrilaterals with $4$ equal sides and $4$ right angles.

This shape is a quadrilateral with $4$ sides of equal length, but it does **not** have $4$ right angles, so it is **not** a square.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation: ![Three different squares. Each square has four sides equal in length and four right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c89a31fc913d5ff08b7b4c655e077f40d5170d66)

hints.content:
The following names can classify the shape:

- Rhombus

- Quadrilateral

options.alt: A four-sided shape. Each side is labeled 5 centimeters. The corners of the shape are not right angles. !
